results.title: Coping with deafness
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Richard Dobson
results.brief_description: Bob, Maree and Sadie have hearing impairment. They have illustrated, by means of their own simple sketches, how deafness has affected their lives and how they cope with their disability. Interviewer: Pat Pengilley.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Richard Dobson

results.title: Coping
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Job Catch”.
This is part of series designed for use by upper secondary students and school leavers. The transition from being a student to a working young adult seeking independence can be fraught with unexpected responsibilities and financial problems. This program describes what to expect once you begin working, together with hints on basic survival techniques and personal budgeting.

results.title: Copenhagen holiday [edited version]
results.brief_description: A film whose feature is the Bing and Grohndahl Porcelain Potteries in Copenhagen. Shows the beautiful ceramic figures being made and hand-painted. The sung narration adds an unusual slant to the film. (Note this is an edited version of “Copenhagen holiday”, Title Code 002410).

results.title: Cooma: gateway to the Snowy Mountains
results.creator_credit: Cooma Municipal Council and George I. Malcolm
results.brief_description: Shows the tourist attractions of Cooma in New South Wales. Includes fishing for trout, hiking, the scenic Snowy Mountains, hydro-electric undertakings, and the wonderful snow fields within easy reach of the town.

results.title: Cool creatures : reptiles
results.brief_description: This video examines reptiles, noting their characteristics, major groups, kinds and interesting traits of reptiles, both extinct and in existence today. Reptiles identified and discussed are: turles, lizards, snakes, crocodiles, alligators, gharials and ciamans. Different reptile habitats are explored, along with the reptile’s mechanisms for survival. Suitable for Primary level students.
results.description: This video examines reptiles, noting their characteristics, major groups, kinds and interesting traits of reptiles, both extinct and in existence today. results.title: Cool change
results.creator_credit: Dennis Wright, Delatite Productions and George Miller
results.brief_description: Set in the highlands of Victoria, deals with a bitter struggle between the greenies and the cattlemen. When the government moves to evict a woman who is running more cattle on her property than the law allows, the other cattlemen band together to battle on her behalf.

results.title: Cool Cats: 25 Years of Rock `N` Roll
results.brief_description: Cool Cats traces the evolution of rock-related style, fashion and affectation; from stovepipe trousers, drape jackets and duck’s tail haircuts to bondage straps, androgynous jumpsuits and lethal Mohican scalp spikes. The performances and posturing of the Rolling Stones, Little Richard, Tina Turner, The Beatles, among others, are intertwined with observations from the likes of Pete Townshend, Phil Everly, Malcolm McLaren and Grace Slick. Rating: G

results.title: Cooks in clover
results.creator_credit: Film Workshop, Gas Council and Dennis Shand
results.brief_description: Traces the regional origins of traditional British food, and shows how anyone interested in cooking can recreate the sumptuous fare of the past by the use of modern techniques in cooking. Demonstrates how to obtain perfect results when preparing Dover Sole, Melton Mowbray Pork Pie and the Roast Beef of Old England with comparative ease.
